com.splunk.journal.hive

Class JournalSerDe

  • java.lang.Object
    • AbstractDeserializer
      • com.splunk.journal.hive.JournalSerDe

  • public class JournalSerDe
extends AbstractDeserializer

    A deserializer for Splunk raw data journal files, to be used in conjunction with JournalInputFormat in Hive table definitions. Value tuples will be used as rows. Key tuples will be ignored.

    Serde properties: Any of the configurations described in RecordReaderHelper can be specified in the SERDEPROPERTIES section of the table definition, but some will have no affect on query behavior. Important properties are:

    com.splunk.journal.hadoop.value_format: Will determine the columns included in the value tuples. If the table definition has the same number of columns as the value tuples, and if each column has a primitive type, then those column definitions will be kept. Otherwise, the columns will have the field names from the underlying data, and the types will all be STRING type.

    com.splunk.journal.hadoop.suppress.exceptions: Affects behavior of the RecordReader if it encounters malformed data, as described in RecordReaderHelper.

    In addition, one property is accepted which is not from RecordReaderHelper:

    com.splunk.journal.hadoop.lenient: Determines what happens if a field returned by the RecordReader cannot be converted by this serde into the correct type for the given table column. If "false", then an exception is thrown and the query will fail-fast. If "true", a NULL value will be returned for that field. The default is "false". Note that in particular if an event does not have a given field, the underlying RecordReader will return the empty string "". This cannot be converted into a numerical or date type, so this property will control what happens. (If the column type is textual and this property is false, the field value will be the empty string.)

    The following table definition uses this deserializer such that the DDL column definitions will be respected.

     CREATE TABLE splunk_event_table (
     Time             DATE,
     Host             STRING,
     Source           STRING,
     date_wday        STRING,
     date_mday        INT
 )
 ROW FORMAT SERDE 'com.splunk.journal.hive.JournalSerDe'
 WITH SERDEPROPERTIES (
    "com.splunk.journal.hadoop.value_format" = "_time,host,source,date_wday,date_mday", "com.splunk.journal.hadoop.lenient"="true"
 )
 STORED AS INPUTFORMAT 'com.splunk.journal.hadoop.mapred.JournalInputFormat'
 OUTPUTFORMAT 'org.apache.hadoop.hive.ql.io.IgnoreKeyTextOutputFormat';
